Package main.java.handlers

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
main.java.handlers.FileHandler
public class FileHandler extends Object
The FileHandler class provides methods for handling file operations related to users and cars.

  • Method Details

    • fileHeaderIndex

      public static LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> fileHeaderIndex(String filename) throws IOException
      Reads the header line of a CSV file and creates a mapping of header names to their corresponding indices.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing header names as keys and their corresponding indices as values.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • createTicketMap

      public static HashMap<Integer,Ticket> createTicketMap(String filename, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> ticketHeaderIndexMap) throws IOException
      Creates a HashMap of tickets read from a CSV file, with ticket IDs as keys and Ticket objects as values.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file containing ticket data. Must inclue resources/____.csv to scan from the correct file
      ticketHeaderIndexMap - A LinkedHashMap containing header names as keys and their corresponding indices as values.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing ticket IDs as keys and corresponding Ticket objects as values.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • createCarMap

      public static HashMap<Integer,Car> createCarMap(String filename, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> carHeaderIndexMap) throws IOException
      Creates a HashMap of cars read from a CSV file, with car IDs as keys and Car objects as values.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file containing car data. Must inclue resources/____.csv to scan from the correct file
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing car IDs as keys and corresponding Car objects as values.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • createUserMap

      public static HashMap<String,User> createUserMap(String filename, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> userHeaderIndexMap) throws IOException
      Creates a HashMap of users read from a CSV file, with user IDs as keys and User objects as values.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file containing user data. Must inclue resources/____.csv to scan from the correct file
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing user IDs as keys and corresponding User objects as values.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • updateTicketFile

      public static void updateTicketFile(String filename, HashMap<Integer,Ticket> ticketMap, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> headers)
      Updates a CSV file with ticket data using the provided filename, ticket map, and headers.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the CSV file to be updated. Must inclue resources/____.csv to save to the correct folder
      ticketMap - A HashMap containing car data, where the keys are integer IDs and the values are Car objects.
      headers - A LinkedHashMap containing header names and their corresponding indices. This is used to ensure consistent ordering of columns in the CSV file.

    • updateCarFile

      public static void updateCarFile(String filename, HashMap<Integer,Car> carMap, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> headers)
      Updates a CSV file with car data using the provided filename, car map, and headers.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the CSV file to be updated. Must inclue resources/____.csv to save to the correct folder
      carMap - A HashMap containing car data, where the keys are integer IDs and the values are Car objects.
      headers - A LinkedHashMap containing header names and their corresponding indices. This is used to ensure consistent ordering of columns in the CSV file.

    • updateUserFile

      public static void updateUserFile(String filename, HashMap<String,User> users, LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> headers)
      Updates a CSV file with user data using the provided filename, user map, and headers.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the CSV file to be updated. Must inclue resources/____.csv to save to the correct folder
      users - A HashMap containing user data, where the keys are integer IDs and the values are User objects.
      headers - A LinkedHashMap containing header names and their corresponding indices. This is used to ensure consistent ordering of columns in the CSV file.

    • updateLogFile

      public static void updateLogFile(String filename, String log)
      Method to add a log input to the end of the log file.
      Parameters:
      filename - Location of Log file
      log - String value of the Log being added to the file.
